cyclone.name: ALEX
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (40 mph – not yet named, PTC status)
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi north of the western tip of Cuba and 300 mi southwest of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northeastward, crossing the southern-central Florida peninsula Saturday then moving offshore into the southwest Atlantic toward the waters north of the north-western Bahamas and eventually in the general direction of Bermuda.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern Florida peninsula near the Naples / Fort Myers area (then tracking across central Florida)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida east coast north of Volusia/Brevard County line.
weather_observation.warning_coast: East coast of Florida south of the Volusia/Brevard County Line to Card Sound Bridge, including Port Canaveral area; west coast south of the Middle of Longboat Key to Card Sound Bridge; Florida Keys; Lake Okeechobee.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-central and southeast Florida coasts, including Brevard County (Port Canaveral), the Keys, and northwest Bahamas.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible at Port Canaveral Saturday, highest Saturday afternoon.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of around 1 ft possible; levels above 3 ft are not expected for Port Canaveral.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible across east-central Florida with localized higher amounts, producing flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Saturday; brief squalls reducing visibility and affecting vessel handling.
